lines.text: People don't marry crooners. They only divorce them.
This radio's a good racket!
Radio! Psstttt! Singing for soap, a flea powder, dough biscuits, or a cheese. I will not permit it!
[Walks away, turns around, walks back]
Do you think they would be interested?
You can't tell. Maybe I'll even turn out to be a crooner.
In Italian, there is no word for crooner.
That's okay, Professor, in English, there's no word for spaghetti.
Young woman, do you know who I am?
No.
I'm Eduardo de Vinci!
That could be fixed.
When poor Mr. Flaggenheim, was alive and running the business, he seemed to think that all cheese needed was an oder. Experience has taught me that what a cheese needs is romance.
Miss Hughes, I salute you.
Go as far as you like.
Ah, the goddess of light, herself, the fairest lady in all Babylon. How are you, baby?
It is like I have always told you, a singer, an artist, can get a no where in this country. Animal noises, a jazz band, a bad a jokes, that's what they want.
Now, Alice, you'll have to take charge of Mrs. Flaggenheim. She's got this foreigner bug in her bonnet and can't get it out.
I'll do the best I can, Mr. Richards.
Say, I see you didn't lose your job.
And I still see you're still driving a cab.
He says a, for that, he would not even let you have his gondola.
Oh, well, my lands, Alice, I wouldn't even know how to hold it.
